segments.text: Do you have a car or motorbike ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In that case , you can park either in a student lot or on the street . Are you aware of the marked handicapped spots ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , I haven't seen those spots .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The handicapped logo with blue means that you are not to park there unless you have a handicapped permit . Will you mostly be parking during the day or the night ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Make sure you pay special attention to the street signs with time limits . Have you noticed those signs ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , I have not seen the signs .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Pay attention to what the signs tell you in terms of time limits and what days you can park there . Do you know what the curb colors mean ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , I don't know what the curb colors mean .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Just remember that red means absolutely no parking and white means loading and unloading only . I think you'll be good to go !
segments.speaker: S2
